title: Salman Rushdie: Did a ‘chance’ airport meeting lead to fatwa?
description: Two British imams met an Iranian minister hours before the decree calling for the author’s death, was issued in 1989.

title: Apollo Remastered: One man's mission to show us the Moon
description: One man's quest to present the historic Moon missions in a way that befits their importance.

title: ‘My daughter happened because of the Gay Games’
description: Organiser Sara Waddell Lewinstein looks back on the first Gay Games

title: China's severe drought from the air
description: More than 70 days of extreme temperatures and low rainfall drive the country's record drought.

title: Olivia Pratt-Korbel: Second murder arrest over shooting
description: A second man is arrested on suspicion of murder after the shooting of nine-year-old Olivia Pratt-Korbel in Liverpool.

title: FBI cites 'evidence of obstruction' in Trump Florida home search
description: Top secret files were kept at Mar-a-Lago along with assorted newspapers and magazines, say investigators.

title: England v South Africa: The Ben Stokes Show - in more ways than one
description: England captain Ben Stokes is such a special talent that he even managed to be the centre of attention in two places at once, writes Stephan Shemilt.

title: Ellen White suffered punctured lung during acupuncture
description: England striker Ellen White says a punctured lung she suffered last year while receiving acupuncture treatment accelerated her retirement.

title: England v South Africa: Ben Stokes and Ben Foakes centuries give hosts big lead
description: Watch highlights as centuries from Ben Stokes and Ben Foakes give England complete control of the second Test against South Africa after two days at Old Trafford.

title: Huge dinosaur skeleton unearthed in Portuguese garden
description: The massive discovery was made during building work on a house in Pombal in central Portugal.

title: Climate change: Russia burns off gas as Europe's energy bills rocket
description: Russia is burning off millions of dollars in gas every day at a plant near the Finnish border.

title: Royal Mail strike: 115,000 postal workers begin strike
description: Delivery delays are expected as staff walk out on on the first of four strike dates.

title: Zuckerberg tells Rogan FBI warning prompted Biden laptop story censorship
description: In an interview with Joe Rogan, Mark Zuckerberg says the story was flagged after an FBI warning.

title: Liverpool shooting: Murder arrest over Olivia Pratt-Korbel's death
description: Police investigating the death of Olivia Pratt-Korbel in Liverpool arrest a man in an armed raid.

title: Macron says UK and France face problems if leaders unsure over friendship
description: The French president warns of "problems" after Liz Truss doubted if he was "friend or foe".

title: Covid infections keep falling in August across UK
description: The ONS says it will "closely monitor" the numbers testing positive as children return to school.

title: Ukrainian refugees: More finding work in UK, ONS survey shows
description: A survey of more than 1,000 Ukrainians finds the number in work and with bank accounts has increased.

title: Europa League draw: Man Utd and Arsenal handed favourable draws
description: Manchester United will play La Liga side Real Sociedad while Arsenal will face former champions PSV Eindhoven in the Europa League group stage.

title: Panto: The industrial estate hiding the secrets of a British tradition
description: The BBC's Simon Spark has been finding out where all those winter panto props spend the summer.

title: Formula 1: Audi to join from 2026
description: Audi is to make its debut in Formula 1 in 2026.

title: BTec delays known about from July, says MP
description: Pearson and others will be quizzed in the Commons about why students are still missing results.

title: England v South Africa: Jonny Bairstow and Zak Crawley fall early to Anrich Nortje
description: Anrich Nortje claims the wickets of Jonny Bairstow and Zak Crawley early on day two of the second Test between England and South Africa at Old Trafford.

title: Lily Sullivan: Murderer Lewis Haines jailed minimum 23 years
description: As Lewis Haines is jailed, 18-year-old Lily Sullivan's mother says: "I will never have peace".

title: ECB high-performance review proposes less domestic cricket
description: A smaller County Championship top division and fewer playing days are among proposals from a review into the men's game in England and Wales.

title: Energy prices: It's costing more to keep me alive
description: Dawn White has renal failure and worries about the growing energy cost of her haemodialysis machine.

title: Why are global gas prices so high?
description: European gas prices are now about 10 times higher than their average level over the past decade.

title: 'Lives at risk' without more help on energy bills
description: Experts are warning that higher energy prices will leave people dangerously cold and hungry this winter.

title: Martin Lewis 'begging, praying' for more energy bills help
description: Consumer expert Lewis says a lack of government support is causing a "mental health catastrophe".

title: DJ Eliza Rose says UK club scene should be like Berlin
description: Chart-topping DJ Eliza Rose speaks about the importance of small venues to get people "raving again".

title: Paul Allen: Largest art auction ever to sell Microsoft co-founder's $1bn collection
description: The proceeds of the largest art auction ever will go to charity, Christie's auctioneers said.

title: Scar House Reservoir: Sunken medieval village reappears
description: The settlement in North Yorkshire features on 16th Century maps and was home to 1,250 people.

title: 'I live on ready meals as my electric cooker costs too much'
description: As the latest energy price cap is announced, BBC News speaks to a struggling former care worker.

title: Beaver dams in east Devon create area of wetland amid drought
description: A number of beaver families have created the wetland in east Devon in less than a year.

title: Keanu Reeves visits Northamptonshire pub for meal and meeting
description: The pub manager says The Matrix star is "a lovely, down to earth guy".

title: Edinburgh people hiring skips and baths to store rubbish
description: Flat owners in Edinburgh have been told to hold onto their rubbish as bin strikes continue.

title: Gamescom: The Ukrainian video game makers who kept working in a war zone
description: Iryna Bilous and Nika Avayan fled their homes but are now at the world's largest gaming conference.

title: Energy price cap: 'It's hard but I won't be a burden to anybody'
description: As households find out how much their energy bills will rise, BBC News gets reaction in Ipswich.

title: Reading and Leeds Festivals: Nirvana dancer Tony reflects on their 'gig of the decade'
description: The US band's British unofficial fourth member reflects on their historic Reading set 30 years ago.
